Gives you the feeling of having a purpose in a multiplayer First Person Shooter. Save the hostages or defuse the bomb while your teammates cover you with supressing fire. Even when you have a bit of a day when your internet is being all lousy? Don't worry, playing with bots gives the feeling that you are playing with online players. Only the problem is they need to be on a higher difficulty to really act like players which is a bit dissapointing. In overall this game gets an 8 out of 10.

Устарела, но когда то была ок!!! поиграть стоит)

Pour moi ce Counter-Strike: Source est le meilleur de la saga des CS.

Jeu avec diférents mods varié, on y retrouve tout le plaisir de jouer en solo comme à plusieurs.
Malgrès que ce jeu date un peu, il reste mon préféré, il est tout simplement indémodable avec le temp, les modes ajoutés dessus sont juste parfait, communauté excellente avec peu de hacks/Cheats.

Je conseil vraiment ce jeu à ceux qui joue pour le fun, le délire et la connerie !

PS: Ceci est une évaluation.
PPS: Ceci est encore une évaluation pour le badge steam 2021

CounterStrike: Source is, in my opinion, a massive improvement over it's predecessor, CounterStrike, known now as "CounterStrike 1.6". 

The capabilities of the Source engine bring a much more immersive and content-full package than the previous instalment, and even though it was released in 2004 with visuals that are definitely taking the toll of time, it still manages to stay relevant today, still used for the hardcore tournaments we can all only dream of entering. The controls are some of the tightest ever seen in a FPS, a possession of pin-point accuracy being the only way to win. The controls seem to reach a point between the raw stages of CS:1.6, and the slightly cushioned controls of it's sequel. Matches are intense and suspenseful, with your life being your only one for the whole round with no respawns, and a pleasing array of weaponry to choose from, providing for some of the best tactical game play to be found.

The issue here is it's age however, and while the game is still relevant in tournaments, the public matches have become much less of a joy. Only the pros remain to play another day, with hackers plague servers they are not on, as less people play and report cheaters. As it stands, it's hard to find a middle ground between these two issues (if you can call the presence of good players an issue), as you constantly look for a match that is either not full of people who would legitimately rape you, or either full of shameless hackers who WILL illegitimately rape you. Furthermore, the lack of game modes has always been an issue for the early CS titles, and this one is no different, with only two official game modes available, Defuse and Hostage Rescue. Sure, other game modes have their place as mods, but these are harshly unbalanced and unpolished.

Regardless, buy this for some award winning team play and tactical game play that other franchises like Call of Duty just can't seem to provide. Essential...

+ Perfect controls
+ Exhilarating and tense tactical team game play
-  Lack of game mode options
-  Hackers... I mean difficulty. 

8/10 ~ Amazing

EpicSouls (Sam)

One of the best source engine based games ever, you have to give it a try!

The most famous multiplayer FPS series is hands down, Counter-Strike. 

CS:S used to be the multiplayer FPS standard for the longest time. If you decide to play, you will see why. It's yet another Valve original idea.

Built off the Counter-Strike 1.6 game, the Source engine allows this title to do a lot more. Details allow the maps to come to life, without being taxing on the system.

While the above is true, you will find the newest Counter-Strike title, CS:GO better for first timers. Counter-Strike is a odd game, and CS:S simply doesn't have the support to guide you on how to play the right way. While you have to play a CS title to call yourself a true PC gamer, Source may not be the best option.

7.5/10

For more clarity, I enjoyed this one, even not being a hardcore CS player. IT is quite hard when pitted against people who have played games like this for years, but that doesn't take away from the fun too much. There are a couple people in the community that will rustle with your jimmies, but it's managable. Not the best game I've played but makes hardcore shooters enjoyable.
